intro: Lespedeza prairea, commonly known as silverleaf lespedeza, is a low-growing perennial forb native to the eastern and central United States. It features slender, branched stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically silver-gray in color, providing a distinctive appearance. The plant produces tiny, pink to reddish-purple flowers in late spring to early summer, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in prairie, woodland, and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in native plant gardens.
